markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Great Grodair](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1637)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Beast](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 33

**[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 33

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 7">[Great Grodair](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1637)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="CN" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Amphibious" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=207" />
<trait label="Beast" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=20" />
<trait label="Fey" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=69" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=165" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #170: Spoken on the Song Wind](/Sources.aspx?ID=97) pg. 59</row>

**Perception** +16; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**
[Aquan](/Languages.aspx?ID=14), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +17, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +15, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +15, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +17, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +14

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +5

**Dex** +1

**Con** +4

**Int** +1

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +4
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 23 

**Fort** +18 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +14 

</row>

**HP** 130

**Death Flood** ([conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165)) When the great grodair dies, his body explodes in a blast of pressurized water that deals 6d6 bludgeoning damage to creatures within a 15-foot emanation (DC 25 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). A creature that fails its save is [pushed](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) 5 feet (or 10 feet on a critical failure).

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, swim 50 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +18,
**Damage** 2d10+9 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tentacle +18 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 1d12+9 bludgeoning plus [Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=20)

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
water jet +16 ([range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)),
**Damage** 4d6 bludgeoning plus [Push](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=25) 10 feet

**Primal Spontaneous Spells** DC 25
- **5th**
[Control Water](/Spells.aspx?ID=51)

**Muddy Field** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157), [Water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165)) The great grodair transforms all soil, sand, or similar sediment in a 10-foot emanation into mud for 1 round. This mud is difficult terrain for creatures other than grodairs.

**Organ of Endless Water** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165)) The great grodair causes water to pour from a magical sac on his spine, either a stream of water at a rate of 1 gallon per round, or a fountain in a 5-foot-long stream at a rate of 5 gallons per round. He can stop the flow of water as a single action.

</column>
name: Great Grodair

text: Great Grodair Recall Knowledge - Beast (Arcana, Nature): DC 33 Recall Knowledge - Fey (Nature): DC 33 Unspecific Lore : DC 31 Specific Lore : DC 28 Great Grodair Source Pathfinder #170: Spoken on the Song Wind pg. 59 Perception +16; darkvision Languages Aquan, Common, Sylvan Skills Athletics +17, Intimidation +15, Nature +15, Performance +17, Survival +14 Str +5 Dex +1 Con +4 Int +1 Wis +2 Cha +4 --- AC 23 Fort +18 Ref +12 Will +14 HP 130 Death Flood (conjuration, primal, water) When the great grodair dies, his body explodes in a blast of pressurized water that deals 6d6 bludgeoning damage to creatures within a 15-foot emanation (DC 25 basic Reflex save). A creature that fails its save is pushed 5 feet (or 10 feet on a critical failure). --- Speed 25 feet, swim 50 feet Melee Single Action jaws +18, Damage 2d10+9 piercing Melee Single Action tentacle +18 (reach 10 feet), Damage 1d12+9 bludgeoning plus Knockdown Ranged Single Action water jet +16 (range increment 60 feet), Damage 4d6 bludgeoning plus Push 10 feet Primal Spontaneous Spells DC 25 - 5th Control Water Muddy Field Single Action (Primal, Transmutation, Water) The great grodair transforms all soil, sand, or similar sediment in a 10-foot emanation into mud for 1 round. This mud is difficult terrain for creatures other than grodairs. Organ of Endless Water Single Action (Conjuration, Manipulate, Primal, Water) The great grodair causes water to pour from a magical sac on his spine, either a stream of water at a rate of 1 gallon per round, or a fountain in a 5-foot-long stream at a rate of 5 gallons per round. He can stop the flow of water as a single action.
